Game Rules
(stolen and modified from Tierce, Magua, and callforjudgement)

General Rules
1. The site-wide rules apply. Read them, know them, love them, do not break them.
2. Play to win.
3. Do not edit or delete your posts in this thread. If there is a problem with a post, such as incorrect formatting, ask me to fix it for you.
4. Do not quote communications outside the game thread, including role PMs, quicktopics, etc., in the game thread. This specifically includes PM timestamps. Paraphrasing is allowed. If in doubt, ask.
5. Do not use cryptography, invisible text, tiny text, or the like.
6. Do not use any form of provable randomness. Claiming you rolled dice and acting on that is fine. Using dice tags is not.
7. Do not impersonate or pretend to be the moderator. If I edit a post, I will use this color. Do not use this color.
8. Unless the moderator has specifically told you it is allowed, do not talk about this game outside of this game thread until it is completed.
9. Do not bring outside factors into this game. This includes, among other things, making bets, promises of real life rewards, etc.
10. Claiming scum by yourself is fine. Claiming scum with others is not, regardless of the truth of this claim.
11. Pretending to break a rule will be treated the same as breaking the rule.
12. We're all here to have fun. Tempers may flare, but avoid personal attacks and keep it civil.
13. Breaking one of these rules may, at my discretion, result in a modkill. If you are modkilled, you will become a Neutral Survivor, and thus automatically lose. Modkilling may or may not end the game day.
14. I reserve the right to change the rules. Rule changes will be posted in thread.

Activity Rules
1. If a player goes two days (48 real life hours) without posting, they may be prodded at my discretion, or upon being asked by another player. Prods will be announced in thread.
2. If a player does not respond to their prod within one day (24 real life hours), is prodded three times in the same game-day, or five times in total within the game, they may be force-replaced at my discretion.
3. If you will be V/LA, please alert me in the thread or via PM.
4. Each game day will have a deadline of two weeks (14 real life days).
5. In the event deadline is reached before a lynch has occurred, there will be No Lynch.
6. Each night will have a deadline of two days (48 hours).
7. If a player has a night action, but does not submit a choice before deadline, they will perform no action.
8. I may extend deadlines in the event replacements must be found, at my discretion. This will be announced in thread.

Voting Rules
1. Votes must be at the beginning of a new line and bolded, and in the format of VOTE: Player name or VOTE: Playername. Abbreviations, missing punctuation, and misspellings will be accepted as long as it is obvious to me who is being voted for. If I perceive it as a vote, it counts as a vote.
2. Unvoting is nice, but is not necessary.
3. Once a majority of votes is reached (# of players / 2 + 1, rounded down), that person is lynched.
4. All living players, including the lynchee, may continue to post until I lock the thread.
5. If you are dead, that is it. Do not post. Not even a "Bah" post.

Setup Rules
As a Mini Normal game, the exact details of this game's setup are not public. However, you do know the following facts about the setup:
1. At least 12 of the 13 players have an explicitly normal role, from the following list: Vanilla Townie, Sane Cop, Doctor, Vigilante, Roleblocker, Mason, Innocent Child, Jailkeeper, Tracker, Watcher, Gunsmith, Miller, Bodyguard, Role Cop, Doublevoter, Hider, Neighbor, Neighborizer, Jack of All Trades, Serial Killer, Mafia Goon, Mafia Traitor, Mafia Godfather, Mafia Framer, Mafia-aligned versions of above roles, possibly with an explicitly normal modifier: Even/Odd Night, Non-Consecutive Night, X-Shot, Bulletproof, Neighbor, Compulsive, Macho, Weak, Backup (with or without primary role present). It is possible that all 13 players have a role on this list; it is also possible that the 13th player has some other role with "basic" Mafia traits.
2. There are either 1 or 2 anti-town factions consisting of 2 or more players; and either 0 or 1 anti-town factions consisting of a single player.
3. The only possible win conditions are the Town, Mafia/Werewolf, Traitor, and Serial Killer win conditions. (So no jesters, lynchers, survivors, or cults.)
4. At least 1 player will get the Vanilla Townie role PM, which looks like this:
Welcome to Mini 1472, [Player]! You are a Vanilla Townie.

Abilities:
You have none aside from your voice and your vote.

Win Condition:
You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and there is at least one town-aligned player alive.

Please confirm via PM stating your role and your alignment.
Role PMs are going out now! Please confirm in the manner specified by your role PM. Game will begin when 11/13 have confirmed.

It is now Day 1! Those who have not confirmed have 48 hours to do so ending in (expired on 2013-07-11 22:30:00)

His point is that he believes there was enough information to start scumhunting, and yet you continued with 'normal talking.' He's right and you're wrong. G) Your reaction to his post three is a Barnum statement (maybe one thing, or maybe the other). It's of no value.
H) There are some grounds for accusing him of hypocrisy. I don't really care though, I don't find this to be a reliable indicator of scum.

Oh the hydra dissonance scum tell angle is bogus. Dissonance is bound to happen when it's two people, and its super duper rare that a hydra will be 100% in sync the entire game even when they work well together. I've never been on the same exact page with every single person when I've hydra'd. What is important to look for is fake hydra dissonance, because a scum hydra will attempt to fake what is normally considered a town tell. Trying to respond to this without actually sounding like a LessWrong commenter (which I am, but doesn't make communicating with people who aren't any easier).

It's a rational consideration, it's not a rational assumption. There is some reason to think there might be a scum power role - there usually is. However, what is a reasonable assumption is that this game is somewhere close to the usual mafiascum idea of a balanced game. If that is the case, then that makes a scum PR seem unlikely in the event that Zach flips scum (which I put in the high nineties percentage wise, the remaining probability space being taken up by the possibility that he had an enormous brain fart and somehow thought offing the next-best claimed PR was the best move for town, and that simultaneously the scum thought offing the same role was the best move for scum in a world where Zach holds a *better* PR). And it makes the scenario where there are only two town PRs, a tracker and a neighborizer (neither of which is that good) AND a scum PR seem really, really, fucking REALLY unlikely to be the case in the eyes of any reasonable person, because that would be stupidly unbalanced.

So the question for me is, do you really think this game is super unbalanced? If not, either your "Scum PR = likely" or "Nacho - not virtually certain to be town" belief has to be discarded.

I remember right after rolling this game, Regfan and I talked about how it should be an interesting and even one to watch. Unfortunately, for the scum team, a lot of bad luck just seemed to hit them too early. The LOBSTA found themselves under a mountain of suspicion pretty quickly and, even though they did a good job of trying to shake it off, they ultimately couldn't. A lot of the players that looked like they could be mislynched given the game state ended up being PRs that had to be killed off. The Fonz did some amazing work in this game, especially with his Day 1 bus, but I felt PoE ultimately caught up to him in the end and his unfortunate V/LA towards the end crippled his opportunity to really turn his wagon around.

The town definitely deserves massive props here for great work pretty much all throughout the game. I thought them pushing through a LOBSTA lynch despite the cop claim was particularly noteworthy, as I think most other towns would have balked at the idea of possibly lynching such a strong PR. A lot of people were on to the scum team early on, despite a lot of the playstyle/personality clashes that occurred throughout. I really want to give a special shout out to Wickedestjr, who played his role excellently and nailed the entire scum team with this post and drove home that The Fonz was the last scum in his final Neighborhood post. I think if he were a bit more active, he'd have been even more of a driving force than he was in the game.

As far as the setup goes, I want to do something simple and basic to get my feet wet as this was my first modded game. I basically went with the investigative PR/protective PR duo but wanted to make sure that they weren't too overpowered (hence the BG and tracker). I threw in a Neighborizer simply because of games like The Wire - having been part of a Neighborhood in that game that I felt was really effective, I wanted to put that to the test here. It would have been interesting to see the behind-the-scenes work Wickedestjr and yabbaguy would have done had they not been run up to claim on Day 2.

Seeing as this was my first time modding, I think I did ok. I wish I could have been more on top of the game after the Bar exam, but real life got in the way of things. I tried my best to keep up and in the end I'm pretty satisfied with how the game turned out.

Thanks a lot to all of the replacements for stepping up to the plate and joining this game. Really couldn't have been a game without you guys. And of course, many thanks to all the friends I bugged to join and play this.

Any comments/suggestions/etc about the setup or my modding are definitely encouraged. I really want to make sure all my future games are the best they can be.

For anyone who's interested, my next game is going to be a Large Normal. I'm actually taking pre-ins for it now if anyone's interested!

Like I said earlier, I think this should be explicitly illegal. Mods can simply reword the rule to read "once you are out of the game by death or replacement, you may not talk in thread". Basically, Mirari disengaged from her win con, then with no game-motive, decided to just jam in a post just for the sake of being derpy. It's a minor point in the scheme of things, but I'm not a fan of it.

@Tammy: The more you play, the more courage you'll get when you vote. I think the key thing for any Townie in the middle of a sluggish game is to try to grasp the plot - who needs to be posting right now or making a decision in order to move the game along? If it's me, do I need to ask more questions, or do I essentially know I'm ready to commit to my choice? You don't categorically need every second on the clock, like we always say in Duplicate Bridge about making final decisions - if you know, go.

Good job on catching on that I was Neighborized. Thank goodness you weren't scum.

@Wicked: Sorry I didn't talk more in the Neighbor thread. Thanks for trusting me straightaway when I claimed in there.

@Empire: If it was writer's block, I'd say just relax and let the flavor flow where it will. When I'm thinking #SWAGTOWN, I was almost expecting the flavor to be kind of derpy and rambunctious, or less than 140 characters *shrug*. But I enjoyed this game, it was really cool that you gave Town 3 powers and yet a 3-Goon armada was still balanced.

It's an interesting thought about scum play, because Fonz's super-aggro bus on PURPLE LOBSTA blew up because his second buddy got lynched on Day 3. My takeaway - bussing credit isn't magic, there's still a lot to navigate through even if you gain that momentary invincibility shield for a few Days. The Mirari/sottyrulez (okay, Zachrulez ) slot I think may have started okay but then dwindled away in activity too much - and I think I've learned that watching to see how your non-bussed partner in situations like this is the key part to any early Day bus. With my all-seeing 20/20 hindsight, I think Fonz's correct move would've been to try and escape the PL wagon at some point once his second buddy started becoming more and more suspicious.

I prolifically posted in the Dead QT, so read there for my of my thoughts - I really like discussing with alive players who see what I've said after the game ends, but I think it was basically a great victory for Town.

After reading through the dead QT (because I really, really like this playerlist and respect the opinions of pretty much every player in this game), I can state unequivocally that I am so glad F-16 and yabba were killed by scum, lol. The dasterdly fiend they made me out to be would've gotten a noose wrapped around my neck before I could say stop. I actually agree with them and didn't think I played particularly well with the exception of going for Fonz there at the end. I didn't even get to vote Zach/sotty like I wanted to on D3 and was worried that that would be used against me. But, whatever, that's townRC for you. I'm just glad that I had SBP, Nacho, and implosion around to protect me. <3 yabba, I love that line "lost the plot". I've heard it once or twice before. I want to start using that for myself.

I think the town really played well here though. We all seemed to compliment each other well with minimal speed bumps along the way. It's almost like we all had townreads on different players and kind of just went like, "well, if you say s/he's town, then okay, I'll go with it". Had implosion and Fonz not been around to talk down scumNacho, I think very much I could've been convinced on that one. So that was nice. Me and Tammy butted heads, but ultimately I never really had a solid scumread on her. I don't know if it was in spite or because of the hostility though. Working with townNacho is always so great. He really helps me focus and I think we can read each other pretty well. When reading through the dead/neighbor QT, it was like yabba and Wicked were kind of different players. I wish, wish, wish they'd have defended each other a little more strongly. Wicked especially shocked me at how solid his reads were when you see what he has to say in the QTs. If only ZZZX hadn't turned so many people off. There was another person that agreed with me (implosion?) that that was just such an abysmal lynch. But that's what is cool about Mafia is that people can interpret things so much differently. I'm totally going to use the "ZZZX tell" going forward though, lol.

The scum and town MVP was Fonz, lmao. It's almost not a joke though. He effectively made the decision to lynch PL. Although he focused hard on SBP during D2, he did end up helping get sotty lynched on D3. And he was just unfortunately not really persuasive enough to defend himself and convince enough people on D4. Whether he realizes it or not, he helped keep me from going after Nacho, DV, and implosion harder at various points in the game. I mean, who knows what would've happened had he come out swinging for any of those three, but I just know that his dismissing of those players are potential scum targets was certainly a factor in me not being as vicious against them.
